page.title: 06MILLTHROP AND PINFOLD
page.content: The hamlet of{Millthrop}was originally built to house the workers at the nearby mill. The mill buildings have now been converted into dwellings. There are thirty-four habitable houses in Millthrop of which four are holiday cottages. Four dwellings are derelict. Most of the cottages are very small and many have been recently modernised. There are no shops but three businesses have their premises in the hamlet - a builder, a small nursery garden and a scrap-metal dealer. The chapel, telephone box and post box are the only amenities. {Pinfold}is a camping site which contains 56 static caravans. By law these must only be occupied for eight months of the year. At the time of this survey there were 28 touring caravans and 26 tents on the site.
